tweets.text: @Rosewood_Farm @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency Yes a lot of Holland is below sea level but they have to get it to the pumps
@Rosewood_Farm @agricontract @EnvAgency So my land drains that run water off and into a main drain then out into the Humber are useless.. i think not.

@hortijames @EnvAgency No matter how good a farmer you are soil is soluble in water I would guess that soil still leaves the field at a certain level under the best notill cover crop systems But. I bet they build more than leaves each year

.@Guardian claims many homes & businesses are at risk of flooding due to ‘ruined assets’, but our blog explains more. 38,000 properties protected during #StormChristoph, no properties flooded due failed permanent defences & all assets winter ready. https://t.co/nB5wHJCW6i

domain.name: Brand
domain.description: Brands and Companies

tweets.text: I've been out today checking with our teams still out working with @EnvAgencyNW. The teamwork between EA and our staff has been outstanding. Still plenty to do, but it's great to see every one working in unison to get the job done.@JamieDixon72 @GroundControlGC @MDrWatson https://t.co/J7MQxYkhQR
@RosieP4 @EssexIsGreen @EnvAgency Looks super interesting - where can we find it to get into the details?
@agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency dig out, it has nowhere to go. It isn't like your house gutters because there is no downpipe.

@agricontract @EnvAgency Common sense as normal olly. It will fall on deaf ears though, They will just blame farmers for soil erosion.  With No thought about sorting the problem just playing the blame game.

@agricontract @sunkfarmer @EnvAgency You're right about an idiots guide - the two things you've overlooked is that Dutch land drainage has lowered the soil levels so that we now have less holding capacity left and the surface is lower (relative to the sea). If the level is lower it doesn't matter how much silt you

Another major @EnvAgencyNW pumping operation being set-up at Ince Marshes pumping station following #StormChristoph  Area teams & national pump specialists working together with s/c partners @GroundControlGC & @Wheelers_Trans  
#whataweek #whatateam #teamworkmakesthedreamwork https://t.co/J4wfHBMDdW

So exciting that Essex Climate Action commission has such ambitous plans for rewilding, land stewardship and natural flood management.  @EssexIsGreen I've been looking recently at data from @EnvAgency which explores natural flood management options (all over the country) 1/

tweets.text:
We are already seeing the effects of #ClimateChange.

Last week our #flood defences protected thousands of people in England from record river levels during Storm Christoph.

Our infrastructure is critical in managing the impacts of the climate emergency.

urls.description: beta This is a trial service – your feedback will help us to improve it. Home Search waste carriers, brokers and dealers People or businesses who transport, buy, sell or dispose of waste, or arrange for someone els e to do so, must be registered. To check a registration, enter the registration number or business name: only carry waste they produced in the course of carrying out their business unless it is construction or demolition waste only carry (carrier), arrange (broker) or deal (dealer) in: animal

tweets.text: @The_WMA @RussellB1ggs @Happy_Mapper @Donna_Dean @DefraGovUK @jamesowild Ah... best laid plans..

We've been at @HardcastleNT today to have a nosy around after the turbulent few days we've been having weather wise. Check out the tethered leaky dams doing their job of keeping Hebden Bridge dry. We are incredibly pleased to see our work doing a grand job.
#slowtheflow https://t.co/WGLm6eQX6F

@SayNo2SizewellC @Jennife15046404 @johnnyrich @KwasiKwarteng @The_ONR @EnvAgency @theCCCuk 14 years away. 10 yrs ago - see what PV panels were like / cost the same for batteries compared to here and now. That technology is improving on a quarterly basis and can be deployed virtually instantaneously.... the 2025 version will make the 2021 versions museum pieces.

@sharon_gibbard @LangarAid @RaviSinghKA @Khalsa_Aid @EnvAgencyMids @ITVWales @nspauk @SikhPA @live_coventry @MarcusRashford @covobservernews Thank you so much, my first hot meal in 3 very long days x https://t.co/seTI5Labn2

Amazing support over the past week to keep us flood free. Special mention for the 3 Dan’s, Big Chris, Kate, Ash, Michael and Roger and everyone else we’ve missed for all their efforts. Greatly appreciated.

urls.title: £100k Get Fishing Fund to benefit new anglers - Angling Trust
urls.description: New Get Fishing Fund will fund more opportunities for new anglers Environment Agency reports over a million rod licences have been sold this year Higher rod licence sales prompts increased investment in the sport The Environment Agency and Angling Trust have today (1st December 2020) announced a new £100k ‘Get Fishing Fund’ to encourage more […]

tweets.text:
Still more than a month to get involved with the push to get more people fishing!

Grants of £500 available to encourage new or returning anglers 

More details and how to apply to the #GetFishingFund from @envagency and @anglingtrust: https://t.co/jy8pwqGam0 https://t.co/sQO7nsaZJD

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile
entity.description: Stories are shared of the people, places and issues at the heart of the British countryside. Popular features include the programme's photography contest, which culminates in a yearly calendar sold to benefit charity, the Video Diary, produced by viewers and focused on life in rural areas, and the weather forecasts.

domain.name: TV Shows
domain.description: Television shows from around the world

entity.name: Countryfile Diaries
entity.description: A sister show to the BBC's `Countryfile' series, this rural affairs programme sees a team of presenters travel the length and breadth of the United Kingdom to cover stories related to the British countryside and the season of spring. As this period is a busy time of the year for the farming and outdoor communities in particular, regular topics covered include the production of food, nature conservation, and a look at a chosen area's culture and history. Stunning landscapes and a variety of wildlife also feature prominently.
